attributes.action: We call upon Parliament to repeal The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act immediately.
attributes.background:
A current petition to Call a snap General Election elicited the response « The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act means no Government can call a snap general election.... » from the government.

M.P.s make laws ; and can repeal them.

attributes.action: Consider taking EDM660 forward into law
attributes.background: Early Day Motion 660 "LEGAL RECOGNITION FOR PEOPLE WHO DO NOT ASSOCIATE WITH A PARTICULAR GENDER" proposes allowing UK citizens who do not identify as male or female to use the X marker in place of M or F on passports in accordance with existing aviation treaties.
attributes.additional_details: There are many individuals in the UK and around the world who do not identify as male or female. Bodies are typically male or female, though some cannot be placed in either category through natural variation, and we find the same holds true of minds. The use of the X marker would have no significant impact on bureaucracy and yet would allow those who fall through the gaps of the current system to be represented honestly in their documentation in a way that is accurate to their lived experience.

attributes.action: Reintroduce Tier 1 Post Study Work Visa for Non-EU students
attributes.background: The discontinuation of this visa affects thousands of students yearly after completing their studies in the UK. Many of us want to stay here after graduating but the difficulty in getting a visa to do so makes it almost impossible. Having this visa be reintroduced would help us and the UK as well.

attributes.action: Reinstate funding for Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy (SDR) on the NHS
attributes.background:
SDR is a neurosurgical procedure aimed at reducing spasticity (tight and stiff muscle tone) in the lower limbs
The surgery aims to:
Achieve a long-term reduction in spasticity
Improve function and mobility
Increase independence 
Increase range of motion and improve positioning.
attributes.additional_details: Reduction in spasticity is immediately apparent after the procedure, but SDR unmasks any weakness and difficulties with co-ordinating movements. Through the physio programme, children will learn to use their body in a new way. There's now enough evidence to demonstrate that SDR is associated with substantial long-term benefits. These not only relate to reduction in spasticity, but also relate to improved movement, walking and an improved quality of life for both the children and their families.

attributes.action: Water safety to be taught as part of the national curriculum age appropriate.
attributes.background: Our loved ones need to understand the dangers in & around open water. The effects cold water can have on the body, The difference between a pool that is sanitized temperature controlled & lifeguarded, To bodies of open water such as quarries, lakes, reservoirs, rivers, canals  that hold many dangers
attributes.additional_details: My son was born on the 17th October 1997 He died on the 3rd of July 2011 age 13 swimming with friends in open water.I believe had Dylan been educated about the dangers in & around open water he would still be with us like so many others would be.Awareness is Prevention.There is no cure for this.A persons swimming ability often makes no difference to whether a person lives or dies. Many who lose their lives in open water never intended on even entering the water.Over 400 accidental deaths a year.

attributes.action: Ban Halal Meat In United Kingdom
attributes.background: I am starting this petition as the produce of halal meat makes me extremely frustrated/upset as I feel this is an extreme and unnecessary way of killing animals for meat produce. I feel that not everyone is aware of how halal meat is slaughtered and I am determined to ban halal meat in England!
attributes.additional_details: In addition to my statement above, I have recently complained to a restaurant who did not fully advertised serving halal meat. In Reading within 1 mile of each other supermarkets and restaurants are selling halal meat without advertising it to the public, this is against human rights of those who do not want to eat halal meat. It is also against individuals religions. Halal meat will be stopped in England.

attributes.action: Make working with electricity a criminal offence unless suitably fully qualified
attributes.background: Qualified Electricians demand stronger enforcement as to who can purchase goods and carry out electrical work. We undertake years of training for qualifications & accreditation for somebody to then carry out a 6 week course and become "competent". This is dangerous and an insult to our industry.
attributes.additional_details: Electrical installations are at the forefront of keeping this Great Britain running and have some of the highest regulations in the world.However, due to short term courses too many so called "competent persons" are carrying installation work no matter how small which is not upto standard. We want to see stronger enforcement for the sale of goods only to FULLY qualified electricians with installation becoming an offence if you are not. Electricity is extremely dangerous & is not taken seriously.

attributes.action: Make Breastfeeding awareness & social attitudes part of the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
The UK has the lowest breast feeding rate in the world, with only 17% successfully breastfeeding for up to 3 months, falling to around 1% after 6 months. 
We want future Mothers to feel there is no social stigma for either breast or bottle feeding, & that they have a choice.
#milknotguilt
attributes.additional_details:
Unicef have started a Call to Action on Breast Feeding in the UK. Details here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/News-and-Research/News/call-to-action/

See breast Feeding rates & figures for the UK here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/About-Baby-Friendly/Breastfeeding-in-the-UK/UK-Breastfeeding-rates/

NHS information r.e Breast Feeding: http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/pregnancy-and-baby/Pages/benefits-breastfeeding.aspx

Campaign hashtag #milknotguilt

attributes.action: Investigate the implications of sanctioning citizens in receipt of benefits.
attributes.background: It has been reported that suicides have occured following the removal of financial state support for some of our citizens.  This needs to be investigated.  Are the actions of the Department for Work & Pensions contrary to Human Rights legislation ?

attributes.action: Reopen all children's centres.
attributes.background: Children’s centres serve the most deprived areas and have high levels of usage. Children attending such centres show a good level of development at EYFS, and parents show a significant improvement in parenting skills and confidence. Financial cuts are forcing many children's centres to close.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/485346/DFE-RR495_Evaluation_of_children_s_centres_in_England__the_impact_of_children_s_centres.pdf

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to have any financial interest in the arms trade.
attributes.background: Parliament makes the decision as to if and when the UK enters into a conflict or war. MPs who have a financial interest in the arms trade are likely to be more inclined to vote for such an intervention, as they will probably gain personal monetary advantage from it.
attributes.additional_details: Last February more than 40 MPs were wined and dined by representatives of the arms industry at a cost of £250 a head. This is an example of how the arms trade lobbies Parliament to influence decisions on future conflicts, like the one taken recently to bomb Syria. If MPs were not permitted to have financial interests in arms companies, this would at least go some way to stopping such a dangerous conflict of interest.

attributes.action: To establish an 'English National Anthem' for use at sporting events.
attributes.background: It is time for England to have its own National Anthem, to enable us to establish our English identity and support our role in the United Kingdom. Wales has 'Land of our fathers', Scotland has 'Flower of Scotland' - we want an anthem for England at sporting events.

attributes.action: Let the British people decide to renew Trident submarines or not in a referendum
attributes.background: This isn't the same as voting on unilateral nuclear disarmament.That is a separate debate.This is a chance for the British people to decide whether to spend an obscene amount of our taxes on what many defence experts consider a strategically imprudent and profligate answer.Why? http://tiny.cc/jkeg8x
attributes.additional_details: Why? Because there are divisions within political parties and military and defence circles past and present on whether to spend such colossal sums on its renewal - £167 billion was the latest figure outlined by Minister of State for Defence Procurement Philip Dunne in answer to Conservative MP Crispin Blunt Oct. 25th 2015."The price required, both from the UK taxpayer and our conventional forces, is now too high to be rational or sensible.."said Blunt See Reuters report  http://tiny.cc/evg47x

attributes.action: People with Irlen syndrome and dyslexia to get coloured lenses free on the NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a postcode lottery determines the cost of vital lenses which make a crucial difference to learning, vision and concentration. Some low income families are paying in excess of £200 for a pair of child's glasses which should be free.

attributes.action: Make St. George’s Day an interchangeable National Bank Holiday.
attributes.background: England is one of a very select few who do not yet hold the privilege of being granted their National Patron Saints day off work as a Bank Holiday. We are suggesting that St. George’s Day be introduced as an interchangeable national bank holiday, in exchange with the May Day national bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: So we implore you to embrace your nation, your day and your patron saint and celebrate the country in which we all reside. Do not fall foul of our English tendencies and delve into the therapeutic moaning tendencies that we are all accountable for. Instead stand up and be counted, let’s make a change, embrace all things English and pay the respects to the nation in which we reside. Sign our petition now!

attributes.action: To install traffic lights on the A259 and the B2233 junction.
attributes.background:
There has been several incidents at this section of road.
More recently fatalities.
People have lost there lives due to this dangerous section of road. 
We can't go through the pain and anger of losing anyone els to this section of road.
We need traffic lights before any more incidents happen

attributes.action: Fast track naturalisation for EU citizens resident in the UK longer than 5 years
attributes.background: In view of the vote to leave the EU, implement a simplified fast track process to naturalise EU citizens who have settled in the UK for at least five years. The current naturalisation process is too expensive, overlong and bureaucratic, and penalises mixed EU-UK families.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost three millions EU citizens residing in the UK. Many have settled and created families with British citizen. The split of the UK from the EU will put that status of these people at risk because of the length, complexity and cost of the existing naturalisation process. A fast track process will also ease the pressure on the naturalisation office given the expected surge in applications from EU nationals.

attributes.action: Pass the Cannabis (Legalisation and Regulation) Bill
attributes.background: A Bill to amend the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 to provide for the lawful production, packaging, marketing, sale, purchase, possession and consumption of herbal cannabis in specific circumstances by certain persons; and for connected purposes.

attributes.action: Make it against the law to withhold a defibrillator.
attributes.background: We recently heard of a leisure centre withholding a defibrillator to a nearby school where a teacher was in cardiac arrest thankfully the said lady has survived but next the person may not be so lucky make it law that if you withhold a defibrillator you will be held accountable
attributes.additional_details: The said leisure centre said they withheld the defibrillator as part of health and safety guidelines this is crazy health and safety would rather have a death on their hands

attributes.action: Stop Employment Agencies advertising jobs that don't exist.
attributes.background:
Recently I applied for two different jobs with agencies after spending over 2 hours filling out paperwork and talking to them about the job I went home expecting a phone call that I got promised. Two weeks later the job is still being advertised.
This has happened on many occasions.It has to STOP
attributes.additional_details: Employment agency's are falsely advertising jobs that don't exist.

attributes.action: The UK must put a complete Ban on  Child Immigrants from anywhere in the world
attributes.background:
The United Kingdom is no longer in a position to accept all and sundry.We have enough problems with poor educational levels and a lack of housing and jobs for the indigenous populations of England,Scotland,Wales and northern Ireland.

We must insist that the European union use the existing rules.

attributes.action: Stop disabled parking space abuse in the UK, regardless of location or ownership
attributes.background: Many with disabilities struggle just getting in & out of a parked car, disabled bays are essential. It should be illegal for any non blue badge holder to park their car in a space reserved for those with disabilities. Without this 'The Equality Act 2010' is no longer effective.
attributes.additional_details:
Abuse of disabled parking bays is *rife all over the UK. Vehicles, skips, storage, smoking areas, temporary buildings, cancer screening/blood donor vehicles, temporary displays and more appear all too often in these bays, stopping those who NEED them from using them. Emergency Service Vehicles should ALSO have their own separate parking bay(s) to stop abuse of the disabled parking facilities - a disabled person cannot undo their disability. 

*Ref: www.facebook.com/wantmyspacetakemydisability

attributes.action: Suspend benefit claimant assessments until a public inquiry is undertaken.
attributes.background: The assessment ideology and implementation has serious failings whose accumulated effect mandates an inquiry, and should be suspended until inquiry recommendations are put in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst helping claimants back into work is commendable, the implementation has serious failings :

1. Thousands assessed as fit for work died within 6 weeks
2. The report on these deaths was inappropriately held back
3. The assessment process is overly demanding, intrusive and inflexibly handled, often aggravating mental health issues of claimants
4. There are claims of flawed recording of assessments
5. The assessors are inappropriately given sanctions targets
6. The costs far exceed advantages

attributes.action: Classify laser devices as an offensive weapon when pointed at aircraft.
attributes.background: Laser pointing devices should be classified as an offensive weapon when used and pointed at aircraft that disrupts the flight or distracts the pilot.
attributes.additional_details:
Lasers pointing devices that cause pilots to take evasive action to protect themselves, the crew & passengers as well as the public below the aircraft, should be classed as an offensive weapon.

It is well documented in the media, most recently http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35580261 when a laser pointer is used beyond its normal & intended use as a pointing device, it should carry the same classification as a firearm.

attributes.action: Negotiate the possiblity of British citizens opting to keep their EU citizenship
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to pursue the creation of an EU national status or to ensure the status of EU citizenship for British nationals, who desire such status, during the period of negotiation following the triggering of Lisbon: Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
48% of voters in the EU referendum chose to remain and a prominently cited reason was for access to freedom of movement and the ability to travel - made possible only because we are EU citizens. 

Currently many UK nationals enjoy dual-nationality with many other European countries, usually because they have ties with or have lived in a country for a number of years. Since we all have ties to the EU and have lived there for many years we should be eligible for an EU dual-nationality status.

attributes.action: We want government to start consultation on the future of Sure Start Centres.
attributes.background: During the 2014 election David Cameron made a commitment that his government would not close any Sure Start Centres but they would look at starting a consultation process as to its future. We want the government to start consultation ASAP as centres are in a funding crisis and closing as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Education starts when a child is born. It's a fact that those children using Sure Start Centres have obtained higher educational standards when entering mainstream schooling.

The government stated they would not close Sure Start Centres but funding to local authorities has reduced and as a result many have had to close. We need to look at expertise through consultation and secure funding that shows the importance of these Sure Start Centres, increase centres, give a child the best start in life.

attributes.action: Death certificates to be given to parents of babies from 16 weeks
attributes.background: Please help me to change the law on registering the death of a baby from 16 weeks of pregnancy. I gave birth to my baby boy at 20 weeks pregnant. He did not breathe so I could not register him, which is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: Women who give birth to children prior to 24 weeks of pregnancy are unable to register the death of their babies. This is not fair as they are still babies and the death certificate means a lot. This is very hard for women and thousands of women have been through this. Please help me get the law changed so babies can be registered when they die.

attributes.action: Grants to retrain oil and gas ex employees made redundant from the north sea
attributes.background: A call for funds to be made available to retrain all ex oil and gas workers that have been affected by been made redundant through north sea cut backs and help to find future employment and to be given grants for courses to help gain employment  like the ssi steelworkers

attributes.action: A Start Date for the Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass
attributes.background: After an 50 year wait, the government in 2014 [yet again] gave the go ahead for the A57/A628 Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass to be built. Since then, locals and local politicians are unable to get a start date. We ask the government to name the day work will commence.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of people a day sit in the traffic queues that start on the M67 and continue through Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth and Tintwistle. People have been campaigning for the Longdendale Bypass (also known as the A57/A628 Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass) for almost 50 years. In 2014, the Conservative government approved funding and said phase 1 (Mottram Bypass and Glossop Spur) would go ahead. Since then, the government has refused to give a start date.

attributes.action: Conduct independent review of recognition of Somaliland as independent country
attributes.background: We congratulate the people of Somaliland as they celebrate the 25th anniversary of reclaiming their independence; recognise the strong historical ties between Somaliland and UK; welcome the strong cooperation between UK Government and Somaliland through development aid, trade and security assistance

attributes.action: UK need to invest in Dementia Villages & provide more carers in nursing homes
attributes.background: Dementia affects millions. Both individuals and their families suffer. Nursing homes cannot provide full attentive 24/7 care, due to lack of staff & most are sedated to manage. More physical activity & brain stimulated activities are vital, to prevent rapid deterioration. The Netherlands succeeded!

attributes.action: Protect UK Environment & Wildlife - adopt European environmental legislation.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU could leave our wildlife at risk. The EU has developed a strong set of laws that protect the environment and our wildlife. As these laws will not apply when the UK leaves the EU we need new laws for the UK that give our precious wildlife and environment the same protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Wildlife didn't get much of a mention in the referendum debate, that's a shame as it was something that Europe treasures and its laws were very good for protecting the environment. Without new laws protected sites and our countryside might not be protected unless we have new laws that make sure we take care of it. Many species of plants, animals & invertebrates are declining, the UK Government should make it a priority to do what we can to stop this.

http://www.wildlifetrusts.org/EU-Ref/reports

attributes.action: Review Death by drink driving sentence removing the option of a reduced sentence
attributes.background: People who commit driving offences relating to excess alcohol are given sentences that are reduced after admitting guilt. Individuals do not deserve this opportunity and should serve full term to deter others,highlight the severity of such crime and show judicial support to victims and the families.
attributes.additional_details: Our daughter lost her life due to a drunk driver 3 times over the limit. The sentence was 8 years but given the opportunity to plead guilty this was reduced to 5 years. He was subsequently released having served only 30 months. To any family experiencing such events this type of sentence is severely distressing and flawed. Such sentencing must be assessed and addressed. These individuals are released and free to continue there lifestyles whilst the families are left with the life sentence.

attributes.action: Stop the building of large housing estates nationwide on green belt land.
attributes.background:
The government has pushed local councils to open restrictions on developing green belt land for large estates to be built.
This ignores brown field sites and housing that can be redeveloped.
I support the brown field development.
attributes.additional_details:
The original name given to the project in Sefton Council was The Core Strategy.
All the residents that knew about it raised objections that have not been addressed.
The plans have now been given the go ahead after a huge amount of money has been used for our supposedly cash strapped council to implement.
There reasons for the housing do not stand up to scrutiny. 
There is no infrastructure in place to accommodate the large estates. 
The dessicration of green belt land is therefore not required.

attributes.action: Give a vote in an EU referendum  to  the Isle of Man, Jersey and Guernsey.
attributes.background: Daily life in these British Dependencies is affected by EU decision making. A decision to leave or stay in the EU therefore affects all islanders. Natural justice requires that they have a direct say in such a consequential referendum.

attributes.action: I want all vets to compulsory scan all pets , even if it just the first visit 😊
attributes.background: I have personally reunited a dog (scampi) after being missing for 5 years by chip checking him the owners had owned him for 2 years and he was a little girls best friend , if a vet had scanned this dog at some point it could have saved alot of heart break , sign compulsory chip checking for all vets

attributes.action: Make running over a cat and driving off without reporting it a criminal offense
attributes.background: Recently my cat was hit by a car luckily a very kind woman took her in wrapped her up put her in a towel & box and placed a rose in beside her its really affected us now its illegal to not report a dog, so why not a cat? There just as loved and apart of the family so let's make it illegal !
attributes.additional_details: All animals play a big part in your family so when it comes to running a cat over it should be treated the same way as if you had to run over a dog, your heart breaks just as much wither it be a cat or dog there should be no difference when it comes to justice for our furry friends, whoever ran my cat over must have been speeding due to the mess she was left it now think this could have been a child, your child , anyone with animals know how precious they are to you&your family please sign

attributes.action: Include 'PELVIC PAIN' in the UK university curriculum for ALL medical students
attributes.background: Over 1 million women (and men) in this country suffer from pelvic pain.  Many suffer chronic, debilitating pain. Most struggle to find good medical care as their GPs and consultants received no education about pelvic pain during training.  Please help us make it a part of all medical training.
attributes.additional_details: I am one of those many women who suffers from chronic pelvic pain and it has devastated my life.  Leeds university is the only university to include pelvic pain in their curriculum for nurses. Healthcare professionals who suffer from pelvic pain themselves admit that they received no formal training in pelvic pain in their medical education.  The Pelvic Pain Support Network is a charity that promotes education, research and assists pelvic pain patients. Please support www.pelvicpain.org.uk

attributes.action: Require proof of identity to be provided by all voters in the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: More examples have been found of blatant fraud at polling stations where people who have turned up to vote are turned away having been marked as "already voted".
attributes.additional_details: These days, providing proof of identity is normal almost everywhere. Requiring proof of identity at the polling station ought to be mandatory for everyone who wants to vote, but especially in the EU Referendum, as a further guard against the fraudulent practices now rife throughout the United Kingdom and widely expected to occur during the Brexit vote.

attributes.action: Change the law on the dangerous dog act 1991 Stop putting healthy dogs down.
attributes.background: Innocent dogs and puppies are being put to sleep for no reason, just purely for the type of breed. Why? If they have done no harm and have proven to be safe in public they have the right to live! its inhumane and cruel! why should the dog pay for the irresponsible backyard breeders and owners!
attributes.additional_details: The dangerous dog act 1991 has been created to stop and ban four breed of dog including the Pit Bull Terrier. These dogs are known for dog fighting and built and bred for the large muscular physique. Why should we put these dogs down if they have done nothing wrong? Any breed of dog is capable of killing or causing harm to humans! dogs are not born dangerous, its in the hands of the owner who we should blame! lets change this. backyard breeders and irresponsible owners should be prosecuted.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to stop the massacre of Igbos
attributes.background: Since the beginning of the year, there has been a number of attacks by Fulani herds men, on indigenous Igbo population in the east of Nigeria. The most recent, being an attack on the Nimbo Community in Enugu during which over 50 people lost their lives, several injured and properties destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: Of all these attacks, the Federal Government of Nigeria has been silence. Rather, the federal house is pushing ahead with a bill that will give the herds men full right to graze their cattle's on peoples farm lands. Similar petition is already going on and gathering signatures in the White House. We are appealing to the UK parliament to use its influence to make the Nigeria Government address these killings before it degenerates to inter tribal attacks.

attributes.action: Save Hinckley Cottage Hospital, Leics. from being closed down and the land sold!
attributes.background: Hinckley Hospital is a small and much used healthcare facility in the heart of the town of Hinckley.  It provides day care surgery and other day procedures to the local community who cannot travel out of town. It provides extensive Consultant outpatient care and all professions allied to medicine.
attributes.additional_details:
Hinckley Hospital was built in 1899 to commemorate Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee.  It's a fine example of late Victorian architecture and solidly built.  Since its inception it has been extended, always using local builders to continue to be the hub of Hinckley health care for its residents.  Given its significance & history it is very surprising that Hinckley Hospital is not a listed building.
Hinckley residents will inevitably be denied care if they are forced to travel for health care.

attributes.action: More maternity leave and pay for parents of multiples
attributes.background: The government and employers must rub their hands in delight of the money they save when they hear someone is expecting multiples, as they must save a lot of money only having to give one lot of maternity leave and one lot of statutory maternity pay. Parents of multiples deserve more.
attributes.additional_details: Parents of multiples at the moment are only entitled to the same as parents that have only had one child. Surely that is not fair, especially when it is hard enough to adapt to looking after more than one baby at a time.

attributes.action: Ban the Slaughter of Dartmoor Hill Ponies for Meat for Human Consumption
attributes.background: Dartmoor Hill Ponies are now being slaughtered for meat for human consumption. We call on the Government to halt the scheme which is both promoting moorland ponies as a meat product and also supplying the market. The Government must  enforce effective management of the Dartmoor Hill Pony herds.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from the fact we do not eat our companion animals here in the UK there are also concerns regarding the safety of the meat as, unlike farmed animals, the ponies are roaming free and their grazing is not monitored, therefore their meat may contain harmful substances such as wormers, bute and contraceptives.  The ponies are wild and unhandled and will be terrified at slaughter, their slaughter is inhumane.   Please sign this petition and help save  Dartmoor Hill Ponies from such cruelty!

attributes.action: Maintain the statutory role of the Supervisor of Midwives
attributes.background: Changes in the law recommended by the Kings Fund mean the statutory requirement for midwives to have a supervisor will be removed. Supervisors of midwives safeguard women and babies by ensuring excellence in midwifery practice. This recommendation would remove a vital part of public protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Supervisors of Midwives (SoM) give guidance and support to both midwives and mums to ensure that the care offered is timely and appropriate; is given in the right place; by the right person and that it will benefit the woman, baby and their family. Every hospital has a team of SoMs who are on call 24/7 to directly support women and midwives.
At time when there is clear evidence of NHS trusts prioritising financial balance ahead of quality of care this change will erode safety in maternity units

attributes.action: Stop all subsidies to the fossil fuel industry and subsidise renewables instead
attributes.background: It is now scientific consensus that not only is climate change the greatest threat facing our society but that the human activity of burning fossil fuels is the primary cause. The government is using public funds to supplement this industry that is destroying our children's future. You need to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Reported evidence of 6Bn in government subsidies -http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-government-pays-6bn-a-year-in-subsidies-to-fossil-fuel-industry-a6730946.html

Scientific consensus - http://climate.nasa.gov/scientific-consensus

David Cameron's sense of desperate urgency in his speech to the Paris Conference in 2015 - https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/pm-speech-to-the-cop21-summit-in-paris

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to completely ban the Yulin Meat Festival
attributes.background: It is estimated that China slaughters 10 - 20 million animals a year as part of Yulin Meat Festivals. They are killed in horrific, painful ways, which is why we need to urge the Chinese government to strictly enforce rules to ban such sickening festivals. We need your signature now.
attributes.additional_details:
Dozens are killed weekly, being skinned alive, which is nothing, but wrongful, and sickening actions to do. 
This is why I urge our government to ask China to enforce strict laws to completely eradicate such festivals, to take Yulin to an end, but again, this is not possible without YOUR signatures foe the government to see.

attributes.action: Enable disabled access to the beach and sea (min 1 beach per coastal county).
attributes.background: This petition aims to secure wheelchair access down the beach and to the sea at a mimimum of one beach per coastal county in England. Examples of appropriate strategies include discrete beach ramps or specialist equipment that could be available during seasonal breaks.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition was started by Leanne Burgess, founder of disability awareness campaign 'Changing Impressions'.

This petition started as a result of significant interest on the campaign Facebook page. Resources such as portable and static beach ramps and 'beach buggies', which allowed wheelchair users to join their family and friends on the beach, were warmly received and something that many people were keen to find and use.

We would now like to see more of these opportunities in England.

attributes.action: Muslim school children to be allowed Eid as holiday
attributes.background: Muslim students in the UK don't get a holiday on the two Eid days every year - Eid ul Fitar and Eid ul Adha. Being the only two (or the biggest two) religious celebrations for the Muslims the students should get official holidays on these two occasions.
attributes.additional_details: Islam is the second largest religion with results from the United Kingdom Census 2011. The number of people practicing the religion of Islam in the United Kingdom exceeds 3 million. Some neighborhood towns have more than 50% Muslim population.

attributes.action: October 15th a recognised day of Remembrance for Pregnancy and Infant Loss UK
attributes.background:
This month "The Lancet Report" has shown figures throughout the world for the loss of babies during pregnancy and Infancy.  We are 1:4 by statistic, 2.6 million babies died through Stillbirth in 2015, possibly 50% confirmed pregnancies end by miscarriage.
Help us honour and grieve openly worldwide.
attributes.additional_details:
A day of Remembrance is honoured within countries worldwide.  October 15th, 7pm candles are lit and parents, families and friends honour the lives taken to soon. The USA, Australia, Canada and through charities in Europe, such as Italy. 

Angel Parents UK & GLOBAL 
www.angelparents.co.uk 
T: Angel_parents 

Press reports
Interviews
Facts shared through charities such as SANDS, Tommy and The Miscarriage Association. 
Parents who share their stories
